messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Chores,right this minute?
messages.msgSnippet: Carolyn, it surely is....I mean how many boys this age still do things like that who are with their school friends all day?  I d venture to say not to many,
messages.messageBody:
Carolyn, it surely is....I mean how many boys this age
still do things like that who are with their school
friends all day? I'd venture to say not to many,
there is that "cool" image to uphold. My son is
almost 12 too, in August. Yes, cherish that moment
and know exactly how precious it is. If more parents
could be with their children like this, in a LOVING
environment all day, I doubt that any parent would
dread the coming teen years.



--- carolyn6522 <c_argabrite@...> wrote:

> As I am sitting here reading all the enlightening
> comments about
> chores, I smell the cake I just put in the oven,(for
> dipping in the
> chocolate sauce I made last night). My son(almost
> 12) is standing
> behind me with his arms around my neck, game
> controller about 5 inches
> from my nose, playing on his playstaion2. Does life
> get any better
> than this? Just wanted to pass this golden moment
> on.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>


Happy Learning,
~Sandy
www.360.yahoo.com/aplan4life

messages.subject: Chores,right this minute?
messages.msgSnippet: As I am sitting here reading all the enlightening comments about chores, I smell the cake I just put in the oven,(for dipping in the chocolate sauce I made
messages.messageBody:
As I am sitting here reading all the enlightening comments about
chores, I smell the cake I just put in the oven,(for dipping in the
chocolate sauce I made last night). My son(almost 12) is standing
behind me with his arms around my neck, game controller about 5 inches
from my nose, playing on his playstaion2. Does life get any better
than this? Just wanted to pass this golden moment on.
